channel.description: Appendix D. Contributing to Podman []{#D.htm#pgfId-1286424}My favorite []{#D.htm#marker-1286423}thing about open source is the community effort. It is great to be able to contribute to a project and, better yet, get people to contribute to your project. The analogy I like to use comes from the Grimms’ Fairy Tales story “The Elves” (https://sites.pitt.edu/~dash/grimm039.html{.url}): []{#D.htm#pgfId-1286426 .calibre17}A shoemaker, through no fault of his own, had become so poor that he had only leather enough for a single pair of shoes. He cut them out one evening, then went to bed, intending to finish them the next morning. Having a clear conscience, he went to bed peacefully, commended himself to God, and fell asleep. The next morning, after saying his prayers, he was about to return to his work when he found the shoes on his workbench, completely finished.
